title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: Experience the rich, buttery goodness of this classic Southern Pecan Pie, a timeless dessert passed down through generations. With its flaky crust and luscious pecan filling, this pie is perfect for any special occasion or cozy family gathering.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in chilled diced butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix egg yolk with ice water and stir into flour mixture until dough forms a ball.
Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out dough and place in a 9-inch pie plate.
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Mix in eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract until well blended.
Pour the filling over the pecans in the crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for 40 to 50 minutes, or until the filling is golden brown and set.
Allow pie to cool completely before serving to let the filling set.
tips: Use chilled butter and ice water to ensure a flaky crust. Avoid overmixing the dough to keep it tender. Bake until the filling is just set—overbaking can cause cracking. Let the pie cool fully to achieve the perfect slice.

structured_content.content: This Southern Pecan Pie is a celebration of rich, nutty flavors and buttery textures that melt in your mouth. Its golden crust cradles a luscious filling studded with crunchy pecans, making every bite a perfect harmony of sweet and savory.

note.content:

  • Perfect balance of crunchy pecans and smooth filling

structured_content.content: I first tasted this pie at a family reunion, and it instantly became a favorite. The recipe was generously shared by a dear friend, connecting me to Southern traditions and the warmth of homemade desserts.

• Main ingredient: Pecans provide a rich, buttery crunch essential to the pie’s texture and flavor. Use halves for the best presentation.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract adds depth and warmth, while a touch of salt balances the sweetness.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter and eggs enrich the filling, while corn syrup ensures a smooth, glossy texture.
  • Equipment needed: Mixing bowls, pastry cutter or fork, rolling pin, 9-inch pie plate, and an oven.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in cold butter until crumbly. Add egg yolk and ice water to form dough. Chill for at least 1 hour to relax gluten and firm the dough.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll out dough and line pie plate. Arrange pecans evenly. Mix filling ingredients thoroughly and pour over pecans. Bake first at high heat to set crust, then reduce temperature to cook filling evenly until golden and set.
Finishing Touches:
Cool completely on a wire rack before slicing to allow filling to firm up for clean slices. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream for extra indulgence.

upload.context: Beautiful finished dish with vibrant colors and appetizing presentation

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Start baking at a high temperature to set the crust quickly and prevent sogginess.
  • Don’t overbake; the filling should be just set and slightly jiggly in the center.
  • Look for a golden brown top and firm edges as visual cues.
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerated for up to 4 days. Reheat gently if desired.

structured_content.content: This pie always brings back warm memories of sharing sweet moments with loved ones, filling the room with the inviting aroma of toasted pecans and vanilla. It’s a dessert that truly feels like home.

Enhance the pie by adding a pinch of cinnamon or a splash of bourbon to the filling for a warm, spicy twist. Toast the pecans lightly before adding for extra depth. A sprinkle of sea salt on top before baking can create a delightful sweet-salty contrast.

Serve warm or at room temperature with a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Pair with a cup of strong coffee or a glass of dessert wine for a perfect finish to any meal or celebration.

For a gluten-free crust, substitute the all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. Vegan versions can use coconut oil instead of butter and a flax egg in place of eggs. Add chocolate chips or swap pecans for walnuts for a unique twist.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Keep butter and water ice cold to ensure a flaky crust.
  • Mix filling ingredients just until combined to avoid bubbles and cracks.
  • Use a glass pie plate to monitor crust browning.
  • Brush crust edges with egg wash for a glossy, golden finish.

structured_content.content: With this recipe in your kitchen, you’re ready to create a stunning Southern classic that delights every time. Enjoy the process and savor the sweet rewards of your homemade pecan pie!
